container-title: Nicholas of Sion (The Archbishop Iakovos Library of Ecclesiastical and Historical Sources 10

The remains of Nicholas, Abbot of the Monastery of Holy Sion in Lycia, were buried in his monastery upon his death in 564. The monastery possessed a large number of relics, including some of SS. Sergius and Bacchus. All these references are in a post-Severian homily
